alert.note: Alert for East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued December 25 at 3:26PM MST until December 25 at 8:00PM MST by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST THIS EVENING... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph through the evening. Winds will increase tonight. Overnight through Sunday winds are expected to be southwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 65 mph * WHERE...High elevations, upper slopes, exposed peaks and ridges, and east slopes of the Sacramento Mountains. * WHEN...The Wind Advisory is valid until 8 PM this evening, after that the advisory is upgraded to a High Wind Warning through 6 PM MST Sunday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong west/southwesterly winds could blow around unsecured objects and holiday decorations. Tree limbs could be blown down. Possible damage to light structures.
info.instruction: People should avoid being outside in forested areas and around trees and branches. If possible, remain in the lower levels of your home during the windstorm, and avoid windows. Use caution if you must drive.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes Sacramento Mountains Below 7500 Feet; Sacramento Mountains Above 7500 Feet
